intro: Monanthotaxis schweinfurthii var. seretii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant has a woody stem with opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are usually hairy. Its flowers are solitary and borne on long peduncles, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often found in forest understories or along riverbanks.
